newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bonn's Stark - dlr over 1.72 marks normal correction.
newsitem.headline: Bonn's Stark - dlr over 1.72 marks normal correction.

text.p: German state secretary to the finance ministry Juergen Stark said on Thursday that a dollar/mark exchange rate of over 1.72 marks was part of a normal correction in foreign exchange markets.
Stark also said he saw no automatic dollar appreciation due to Europe's planned economic and monetary union (EMU).
"I do not necessarily see an appreciation in the dollar as a result of European monetary union," he said.
The mark has fallen swiftly versus the mark in recent sessions, touching a 37-month low in overnight foreign exchange trade at 1.7272.
Following Stark's comments, the German unit staged a slight recovery and was trading at 1.7132 to the dollar by 0752 GMT.
